class.name: ClassFinder
class.javadoc:
This is utility class that provides {@code static} methods to find a class with the specified name using the specified class loader.
1.7
Sergey A. Malenkov

Returns the {@code Class} object associated with the class or interface with the given string name, using the default class loader.

The {@code name} can denote an array class (see {@link Class#getName} for details). name fully qualified name of the desired class class object representing the desired class ClassNotFoundException if the class cannot be located by the specified class loader Class#forName(String) Class#forName(String,boolean,ClassLoader) ClassLoader#getSystemClassLoader() Thread#getContextClassLoader()

Returns the {@code Class} object associated with the class or interface with the given string name, using the given class loader.

The {@code name} can denote an array class (see {@link Class#getName} for details).

If the parameter {@code loader} is null, the class is loaded through the default class loader. name fully qualified name of the desired class loader class loader from which the class must be loaded class object representing the desired class ClassNotFoundException if the class cannot be located by the specified class loader #findClass(String,ClassLoader) Class#forName(String,boolean,ClassLoader)

Returns the {@code Class} object associated with the class or interface with the given string name, using the default class loader.

The {@code name} can denote an array class (see {@link Class#getName} for details).

This method can be used to obtain any of the {@code Class} objects representing {@code void} or primitive Java types:{@code char}, {@code byte}, {@code short},{@code int}, {@code long}, {@code float},{@code double} and {@code boolean}. name fully qualified name of the desired class class object representing the desired class ClassNotFoundException if the class cannot be located by the specified class loader #resolveClass(String,ClassLoader)

Returns the {@code Class} object associated with the class or interface with the given string name, using the given class loader.

The {@code name} can denote an array class (see {@link Class#getName} for details).

If the parameter {@code loader} is null, the class is loaded through the default class loader.

This method can be used to obtain any of the {@code Class} objects representing {@code void} or primitive Java types:{@code char}, {@code byte}, {@code short},{@code int}, {@code long}, {@code float},{@code double} and {@code boolean}. name fully qualified name of the desired class loader class loader from which the class must be loaded class object representing the desired class ClassNotFoundException if the class cannot be located by the specified class loader #findClass(String,ClassLoader) PrimitiveTypeMap#getType(String)
